name: N,N-dibenzylhydroxylamine
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base melting point is around 50 degrees Celsius. Two phenyl groups are present, which would significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. Additionally, the presence of two carbonyl groups can form strong hydrogen bonds and rigidify the structure, contributing around +20 to +40°C for each carbonyl. The hydroxylamine group can also participate in hydrogen bonding, which might raise the melting point by about +10°C.
